intro: Cayratia cheniana, commonly known as the Chinese cayratia, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Cayratia cheniana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
